Subject: Social Media for Writers
Description: What social media trends are necessary for the writer building their web foot print? What are some important things to do, and what should you not do?  Speakers include:David Erik Nelson, Michael W. Lucas, Christopher Purrett, Alex Kourvo, Mark Oshiro, Mary Lynne Gibbs - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes

Subject: Screen Writing Tips
Description: Aching to write a script for that great movie idea that's been bouncing around in your head? Come get some tips and tricks for how to get started on writing a script.  Speakers include:James Fernandez, Mary Lynne Gibbs, Dave Kilgore - Track: Media  - Duration: 1 hour and 50 minutes

Subject: Reading/Signing: Jen Haeger and Mary Lynne Gibbs
Description: Join our attending authors in the Writers Block (317 & 318) for readings and signings!  Speakers include:Jen Haeger, Mary Lynne Gibbs - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes

Subject: Character Problems - What's an Author to Do?
Description: A main character needs to start out annoying, boring, or unappealing. (they have to grow from somewhere!) Your readers say 'ugh' and set your book aside. What's an author to do? How do we avoid this? Examples?  Speakers include:Mary Lynne Gibbs, Paul Kemner, Emmy Jackson, Cindy Spencer Pape, Jeff Pryor - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes

Subject: Finding an Agent
Description: What are the best methods for finding the best agent for you?  Speakers include:Merrie Haskell, Ann Leckie, Mary Lynne Gibbs, Christine Daigle - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes
